page.title: 10BASSALEG FARMS-1
page.content: Croesheolydd Farm house was first built in 1605 and is 180 acres with 50 acres of rented grass.The farm is predominantly dairy,with 150 milking cows;80 yearlings and 2 year-old heifers;40 heifer calves and approximately 20 bull calves.The land is mainly grass for the stock but crops of maize and fodder beet are grown for the cows.It has medium loam soil which is good for agriculture. Plas Machen farm is 500 years old.It is a mixed farm with dairying,sheep, bull beef and arable.The soil is loam and the land is mainly for grazing,but corn and potatoes are also grown.The cattle consists of 100 Friesian cows;300 Suffolk and Crossbred sheep and 14 chickens.Sunnybank farm is over 100 years old.It is a stock farm with about 60 cattle and 150 sheep.The soil is mainly used for grass keep.
